thread.title: Auto Makers Weigh In on China’s Tariff Retaliation Threat

author: Chester Dawson
title: Auto Makers Weigh In on China’s Tariff Retaliation Threat
text:
Global automotive executives spent substantial time in 2017 urging the Trump administration to seek reciprocity on trade policies affecting the world’s biggest automobile market. Industry leaders could get the exact opposite.

China’s State Council announced Wednesday it will levy new penalties on a range of products coming from the U.S., including sport-utility vehicles built in factories in states from South Carolina to Alabama to Illinois. Long facing a 25% tariff on vehicle imports built by American workers, the threat...
